pullRequest.body:
add a general construction of a measurable space consisting of sets measurable with respect to some underlying sigma algebra modulo a given sigma filter. Refactor basic definitions and lemmas in `MeasureTheory/Measure/NullMeasurable.lean` to be an instance of this general construction.

The reason is that in the immediate future I would like to define Baire measurability in mathlib, and want to avoid repetition. 

*TODO*: Similarly generalize things about `AEMeasurable`, where appropriate. 

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9430440110/job/25977947402)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9430440110/job/25977947470)
I'm new to reviewing, so I just left some very basic comments. I think it looks good in general, thanks!

```suggestion
/-- We say a set `s` is an `EventuallyMeasurableSet` with respect to a given
```

As you are making `m` and `l` implicit a few lines down, I think that perhaps it might be more readable to not add them here but explicitly include them in `EventuallyMeasurableSpace` and `EventuallyMeasurableSet` below
I prefer to declare `l` here since every declaration in this file depends on `[CountableInterFilter l]`.

I don't think you are currently defining this in terms of `EventuallyMeasurableSpace`, right? Perhaps you might want to consider adding it in this PR, or mention that this will be added in the future?
What do you mean? This PR does redefine null measurability. Baire measurability is not in mathlib at all yet, but the PR description states this as the next goal.

I'm sorry, I only meant to comment on line 16. I meant that the PR description won't be visible in Mathlib, so it might perhaps be good to incorporate this future goal explicitly in the docstring for now, to indicate that Baire measurability will be added in the near future. I was trying to avoid the situation where people might think we have Baire measurability based on this comment.
I see, thanks
See my earlier suggestion on explicit/implicit arguments `m` and `l`.

```suggestion
theorem EventuallyMeasurableSet.congr
```
It's probably a good idea to follow the naming convention already used for null measurable sets.

```suggestion
theorem EventuallyMeasurable.congr
```
ditto

I think I am confused. For me, Baire measurable functions are functions which are measurable for the Baire sigma-algebra, i.e., the smallest one that makes compactly supported continuous functions into measurable functions. I don't see the relationship with the notion you are introducing in this file. Maybe you are thinking of a different notion of Baire-measurability?

Yeah, this is an unfortunate situation. I have more commonly seen what you are talking about called "Baire sets/functions". The notion I mention for sets is sometimes called the "Baire property" but for functions it is usually called "Baire measurable". 

You could definitely make the case for using "Baire measurable" to refer to either notion. Googling the phrase shows a somewhat even number of occurrences for both. 

I am not sure what the right names for mathlib are, but it shouldn't affect this PR other than maybe requiring a change to this docstring.
Sure, I am just asking for a clarification in the docstring of which notion of Baire-measurability you are talking about here.
ok, i added a line about this.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(MeasureTheory): generalize NullMeasurable to measurability mod a sigma filter.
